etymology.description: Mirror image of 爿(爿) (pán, 'piece'), which is the pictogram of a bed.
etymology.interpretation: 片(片) (piàn, 'slice; piece') is depicted as a mirror image of 爿(爿) (pán, 'piece'), representing the concept of a slice or piece, visually similar to half of 木(木) (mù, 'wood; tree') to imply splitting or slicing.

examples.chinese: 我买了一片面包(我買了一片麵包)。
examples.english: I bought a slice of bread.

examples.chinese: 他摘下一片枫叶(他摘下一片楓葉)，轻轻放在桌上(輕輕放在桌上)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhāi xià yī piàn fēngyè, qīngqīng fàng zài zhuō shàng.
examples.english: He picked a maple leaf and gently placed it on the table.

examples.chinese: 天空中飘着一片白云(天空中飄着一片白雲)。
examples.pinyin: Tiānkōng zhōng piāozhe yī piàn báiyún.
examples.english: A patch of white cloud drifts across the sky.
